page.title: 11Llangybi(Tregrug)Castle
page.content: Llangybi Castle,formerly known as tregrug,occupies a wooded plateau above the village.The single fortified enclosing wall encircles the entire plateau,being 540 feet long and 270 feet at its widest point.It is probably the largest castle enclosure in England and Wales and possibly the largest in Europe.There is also a massive Edwardian gatehouse.The earliest written record of the castle is thirteenth century.The castle is now in ruins and covered in vegitation.It is not open to the public and is in the ownership of the Llangybi Estate.Recently the area inside the walls has been used for growing Christmas trees and breeding pheasants.
